description: Borrowed from Urdu منشی‎ (munšī, “secretary; munshi”) or directly from its etymon Persian منشی‎ (monši, “secretary; munshi”), from Arabic مُنْشِئ‎ (munšiʔ, “teacher; writer”).

entries.meaning: (South Asia) A clerk or secretary. [from 17th c.]
(South Asia) A language teacher, especially one teaching Hindustani or Persian.
